name: How Do I Know You Again?

rows.description: We both served time in one of the Empire’s illustrious prisons.
We used to be lovers, but the whims of Katya pulled us apart.
We are distantly related, through a complex web of bloodlines better left unexamined.
We are childhood friends, who grew up in the same rough neighbourhood.
We were once going to be married, but the Rhyans refused to wed us, and we never learned why.
We grew up in the same town, on the outskirts of the same monster-filled wilderness.
We were rivals for the same position, and butted heads for years.
We were rivals for the same paramour who was cruelly stolen from the world by the machinations of Morr.
One of us was a previous victim of the other’s criminal ways, though, thank Ranald, that the victim doesn’t realise it!
One of us once betrayed the other, though by the grace of Sigmar, that past crime has been forgiven… or has it?
We served in the same conscripted militia, and learned to fear the howling of Ulric’s wolves together.
We were refugees together after a Greenskin attack on our duchy.
We met a long time ago, in a city on the other side of the Old World.
We were both victims of the same misfortune under Morrsleib’s pale-green glow.
We were both embroiled in a brawl together, somewhere on Altdorf ’s Street of a Thousand Taverns, and teamed up for mutual safety.
One of us was mistaken for someone else by the other, and lead on a series of curious events before anyone realised.
We met on the road, travelling in the same direction, and, ‘just got to talking’.
We were both framed by a Roadwarden for a crime we didn’t commit.
We were both sentenced to hang when our convoy was attacked by Beastmen and we escaped together.
One of us married the other’s widowed father or mother.
We were both sick and treated by the same Shallyan Order.
We grew up in the same Sigmarite congregation.
We were childhood sweethearts, until one of us had to leave home forever.
Our families have feuded for generations; indeed, our neighbours called our family disputes the, ‘Little Parravonese Wars’.
One of our father’s murdered the other’s in a vendetta worthy of a Tilean opera.
One of our families adopted the other when their family was burnt for witchcraft.
One of us caught the other red-handed picking their pocket.
We both attended a funeral in the Garden of Morr for a mutual friend.
Our mothers were old travelling companions, before they settled down to their respective families.
We both have siblings who were caught up in the same Chaos Cult.
Our siblings ran off together, causing a scandal in both families.
We share a merchant father who was juggling two families, kept secret from each other.
We were both caught during the same raid on a brothel, and had to explain how we were steadfastly not involved with the Chaos Cult discovered out back.
We used to be roommates in a filthy tenement building.
Somehow, our Doomings demanded we meet up, though we obviously keep them secret from each other.
We grew up in rivalling provinces, despite our villages being less than a mile from each other.
We were once shipwrecked together, and had to spend an uncomfortable few months off the coast of Nordland.
We were both onboard ships that were captured by Sartosan pirates, but managed to escape together.
We both caught the same terrible disease many years ago, and were locked in quarantine together before it mysteriously lifted.
One of us turned up drunk on the other’s doorstep with the homeowner’s name tattooed on their arm. Neither of us know how this could have happened, or why.
We were both invited to the same ‘dinner party’ hosted by an aristocrat in a dusty out-of-fashion doublet with a strange accent.
A letter in one of our fathers’ Last Will and Testaments contained the name and address of the other, and we cannot determine why this is…
We were both forced to flee our hometown when our families were caught between two rival gangs.
We were both caught in a crossfire between two charging armies, and barely escaped the bloodshed.
One of us saved the other from a terrible bully when we were growing up, and we’ve stuck close together ever since.
We found each other after not being able to sleep for several nights in a row… The scratching in the walls just got too much, and we got to talking.
We were both using the same river crossing when we were accosted by a notorious highwayman. Let’s just say it didn’t turn out well for him.
We both attended an uncharacteristically and inexplicably free lecture held in the local university, and it changed how we saw the world from then on.
A witch introduced us to each other, and gave the impression it would be ill-advised for us to split up.
We both received a cryptic letter that lead us to the same place at the same time, but then… nothing happened.
